comment._content: I love the two coats ... great shot

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
President Wilson watches the game:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4605957835/in/photostream/]

The Army vs. Navy game was played on November 29, 1913, at the Polo Grounds, in New York City. President Woodrow Wilson was a spectator. Army sank Navy and won, 22-9.

A long view of the field (NYC's Polo Grounds):
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4647768126/]

West Point cadets enter the field:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4647768476/in/photostream/]

Army's mascot is a mule. This one operated by double cadet power:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4606572338/]
